div.a: Our OSPI Washington State Report Card
Our OSPI Washington State Report Card

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-mckenzie-boyd post-type-text article-index-1

h1.a: Pro/Con Statements Needed for August 2020 Levy

div.p: Darrington School District is seeking applications from citizens interested in being appointed to a committee to write the pro/con statements for the Snohomish and Skagit Counties Local Voters Pamphlets related to the Districts upcoming supplemental educational programs and operation levy ballot measure to be considered at the August 4, 2020 election. Those interested should send their name, address, phone number and which position they represent to McKenzie Boyd, Business Manager, Darrington School District, 1075 Fir St, Darrington, WA 98241 or via email at mboyd@dsd.k12.wa.us by April 27, 2020. The Board will take action on the appointments at its April 28, 2020 regular board meeting.

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-buck-marsh post-type-text article-index-2

h1.a: Lunch Service Schedule Change Effective Monday, April 27

div.class: image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

div.p: The Darrington School District continues to exploreways to best serve our community and to keep everyone safe during the COVID-19 pandemic. To improveour social distancing efforts and to be as efficient as possible, we are changing our lunch pick-up schedule:

p.strong: Starting Monday, April 27, in-town lunch pick-up will take place from 11:45-12:15 at Old School Park by the picnic area. Bus route drop-offs will continue as scheduled.

div.p: I appreciate the patience of our community and our staff as we continue to find ways to improveour service to our students and the Darrington community.

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-buck-marsh post-type-text article-index-3

div.p: In accordance with Gov. Inslees Stay Home, Stay Healthy proclamation, along with guidance from the Washington State Attorney General, we will hold the April Regular School Board Meeting online via Zoom. We will have an abbreviated agenda followed by an update on the state of the District during the COVID-19 closure. The public may join this meeting by calling (253) 215-8782 and entering the Meeting ID 915 5737 8917.

div.class: image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none
image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-buck-marsh post-type-text article-index-4

div.p: Many of our community members are battling food insecurity during these uncertain times. Darrington School District Staff want to give back and help out during this time of need. We are sponsoring a food drive in cooperation with Darrington Food Bank. Please see the flyer for more information.

div.class: image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-buck-marsh post-type-text article-index-5

div.p: Congrats to WIAA State Champion Johnny Franke, who recently signed a letter of intent to wrestle at North Idaho College. Way to go, Johnny!

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-buck-marsh post-type-text article-index-6

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-buck-marsh post-type-text article-index-7

div.class: image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

img.alt: The COVID-19 school closure put a halt to spring sports and many end of year traditions. Darrington School District wants our students to know that we are still thinking of them and that they are not forgotten. We will turn on our stadium lights this Friday at 8:20 PM to honor the Class of 2020, our spring athletes, and all of our Darrington students. Per state regulations, the field and school grounds are closed to the public. Please do not park, loiter, or put yourself or others at risk during this event.

Per state regulations, the field and school grounds are closed to the public. Please do not park, loiter, or put yourself or others at risk during this event.

div.p: The COVID-19 school closure put a halt to spring sports and many end of year traditions. Darrington School District wants our students to know that we are still thinking of them and that they are not forgotten. We will turn on our stadium lights this Friday at 8:20 PM to honor the Class of 2020, our spring athletes, and all of our Darrington students. Per state regulations, the field and school grounds are closed to the public. Please do not park, loiter, or put yourself or others at risk during this event.

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-buck-marsh post-type-text article-index-8

h1.a: Meals on Wheels, Lunch Service Update

div.p: As of today, Darrington SD Food Services and Transportation have provided nearly 7700 meals to area youth. Remember to come to the school weekdays 11:30 AM-12:30 PM, or on bus routes starting at 11 AM, to receive breakfasts and lunches. All area youth are eligible for this program.

div.class: image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-buck-marsh post-type-text article-index-9

h1.a: Snohomish Health District: Celebrating Together, Just Physically Apart

div.p: Snohomish Health District recently sent out a guide called Celebrating Together, Just Physically Apart for the upcoming holiday weekend. For more information, go to: http://www.snohd.org/civicalerts.aspx?AID=307

article.class: entry h-entry hentry author-buck-marsh post-type-text article-index-10

h1.a: Meals on Wheels, Lunch Service Update

div.p: We set a new high on Thursday with 252 lunches served. Each day students receive a lunch as well as a breakfast for the following day. These Grab-and-Go meals are served at the school for those who live in town, and distributed along our bus routes. Since the program began, we have served 2911 units for a total of over 5800 meals! Thank you students, parents, and staff for your hard work in fighting food insecurity during Stay Home, Stay Healthy!

div.span: Darrington School District , 1065 Fir Street, Darrington, WA, 98241, United States

div.p: The Darrington School District, with the assistance of an involved community, will provide education and support so that each student is prepared to succeed in life.
